result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thomas John Hopfensperger in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Thomas John Hopfensperger in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Scram Violation Report; received and filed. Court reivewed violation report, no action at this time and will be addressed at next scheduled hearing.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant Thomas John Hopfensperger not in court, in custody not produced.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.   Pre-trial conference held.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.

Defendant Thomas John Hopfensperger in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Thomas John Hopfensperger in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
